title.rendered: Shikhar Dhawan likely to lead, VVS Laxman to coach Indian team at Asian Games 2023

content.rendered:
Shikhar Dhawan is likely to lead the Indian cricket team at the Asian Games in 2023, according to BCCI sources. VVS Laxman, a former Indian cricketer, may also join as head coach for the tournament. However, the final decision has not been made. The Asian Games are not recognized by the ICC and may clash with events like the Asia Cup and the ICC Men’s Cricket World Cup. The Indian women’s cricket team will not have any other commitments in September besides domestic cricket.

(Read Also : ODI Cricket World Cup 2023 Schedule: India faces Pakistan on October 15 in Ahmedabad)

India’s opener Shikhar Dhawan is likely to lead team India and Former Indian batter VVS Laxman to coach at Asian Games 2023, however, the decision is not finalized, according to BCCI sources.

The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) had agreed to send the men’s and women’s teams first time to the Asian Games 2023 which will be held in China.

Apart from Dhawan, the Former Indian batter VVS Laxman can also join the Indian team as a head coach for the tournament.

Asian Games don’t come under International Cricket Council (ICC) and will not be recognized in international cricket.

Notably, the Asian Games could collide with events like the Asia Cup and ICC Men’s Cricket World Cup. The World Cup will be hosted by India from October 5 to November 23 while Asian Games 2023 will be held in Hangzhou, China, from September 23 to October 8.

Meanwhile, apart from domestic cricket, the India Women’s Cricket Team won’t have any other commitments in September. The Indian women’s team participated in the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham.
